citing_paper_authors: Oi Yee, Kwong | Benjamin K., T'sou
raw_text: To date PropBank and FrameNet are the two main resources in English for training semantic role labelling systems, as in the CoNLL-2004 shared task (Carreras and M ?rquez, 2004) and SENSEVAL-3 (Litkowski, 2004)
clean_text: To date PropBank and FrameNet are the two main resources in English for training semantic role labelling systems, as in the CoNLL-2004 shared task (Carreras and Marquez, 2004) and SENSEVAL-3 (Litkowski, 2004).

raw_text: Also from these 321 frames only 100 were considered to have enough training data and were used in Senseval-3 (see Litkowski, 2004 for more details)
clean_text: Also from these 321 frames only 100 were considered to have enough training data and were used in Senseval-3 (see Litkowski, 2004 for more details).

raw_text: Al though the strict measures are more interesting, we include these figures for comparison with the systems participating in the Senseval-3 Restricted task (Litkowski, 2004)
clean_text: Although the strict measures are more interesting, we include these figures for comparison with the systems participating in the Senseval-3 Restricted task (Litkowski, 2004).

citing_paper_authors: Collin F., Baker | Michael, Ellsworth | Katrin, Erk
raw_text: This task is a more advanced and realistic version of the Automatic Semantic Role Labeling task of Senseval-3 (Litkowski, 2004)
clean_text: This task is a more advanced and realistic version of the Automatic Semantic Role Labeling task of Senseval-3 (Litkowski, 2004).

raw_text: Noun predicates also appear in FrameNet semantic role labeling (Gildea and Jurafsky, 2002), and many FrameNet SRL systems are evaluated in Senseval-3 (Litkowski, 2004) .Semantic role labeling of NomBank is a multi class classification problem by nature
clean_text: Noun predicates also appear in FrameNet semantic role labeling (Gildea and Jurafsky, 2002), and many FrameNet SRL systems are evaluated in Senseval-3 (Litkowski, 2004).

raw_text: The same problem was again highlighted by the results obtained with and without the frame information in the Senseval-3 competition (Litkowski,2004) of FrameNet (Johnson et al, 2003) role labeling task
clean_text: The same problem was again highlighted by the results obtained with and without the frame information in the Senseval-3 competition (Litkowski,2004) of FrameNet (Johnson et al, 2003) role labeling task.

raw_text: Also from these 321 frames only 100 were considered to have enough training data and were used in Senseval-3 (see (Litkowski, 2004) for more details) .Our approach for solving such problems involves the usage of a frame-like feature, namely the Intersective Levin class (ILC)
clean_text: Also from these 321 frames only 100 were considered to have enough training data and were used in Senseval-3 (see (Litkowski, 2004) for more details).

raw_text: This task has been the subject of a previous Senseval task (Automatic Semantic Role Labeling, Litkowski (2004)) and two shared tasks on semantic role labeling in the Conference on Natural Language Learning (Carreras& amp; Marquez (2004) and Carreras& amp; Marquez (2005))
clean_text: This task has been the subject of a previous Senseval task (Automatic Semantic Role Labeling, Litkowski (2004)) and two shared tasks on semantic role labeling in the Conference on Natural Language Learning (Carreras Marquez (2004) and Carreras Marquez (2005)).

raw_text: This work attempts to expand on semantic role labeling experiments in Senseval-3 (Litkowski, 2004a, and Litkowski, 2004b)
In addition to the CoNLL-2004 shared task, another evaluation exercise was conducted in the Senseval-3 work shop (Litkowski, 2004)
clean_text: In addition to the CoNLL-2004 shared task, another evaluation exercise was conducted in the Senseval-3 workshop (Litkowski, 2004).

citing_paper_authors: Ulrike, Pado | Matthew W., Crocker | Frank, Keller
raw_text: Beginning with work by Gildea and Jurafsky (2002), there has been a large interest in semantic role labelling, as evidenced by its adoption as a shared task in the Senseval-IIIcompetition (FrameNet data, Litkowski, 2004) and at the CoNLL-2004 and 2005 conference (PropBank data, Carreras and M ?rquez, 2005)
clean_text: Beginning with work by Gildea and Jurafsky (2002), there has been a large interest in semantic role labelling, as evidenced by its adoption as a shared task in the Senseval-III competition (FrameNet data, Litkowski, 2004) and at the CoNLL-2004 and 2005 conference (PropBank data, Carreras and Mrquez, 2005).
